page.title: 07Recreation
page.content: Scarborough Mere is situated 5km south of Scarborough at the foot of Olivers Mount. It was man made about 100 years ago.The water came from the River Derwent originally but it is now fed by underwater springs.The outlet goes underground through the valley out to sea.The cafe and bar was built about 40-50 years ago.There are boats available for both adults and children.Also there is a pirate ship called the "Hispaniola" which takes trips out to an island.The Hispaniola was built at Beverley especially for the Mere in 1954.It is an exact replica of the real Hispaniola.The depth of the Mere varies from 1.5m to 5m,with a channel of 3m for the Hispaniola.The Mere is also used for water skiing and fishing.It is a popular attraction for Scarborough visitors.
